title: Fordham University
summary: Fordham University (/ˈfɔːrdəm/) is a private Jesuit research university in New York City. Established in 1841 and named for the Fordham neighborhood of the Bronx in which its original campus is located, Fordham is the oldest Catholic and Jesuit university in the northeastern United States,[7] and the third-oldest university in New York State.[8]
